parameters.query: INSERT INTO messages (message_id, content, created_at) VALUES ($1, $2, NOW()) ON CONFLICT (message_id) DO NOTHING

meta.description: âœ… GOOD: Webhook captures messageId via Set node. Database INSERT uses ON CONFLICT to silently ignore duplicates.
notes: The Set node captures 'messageId' from the payload
The Postgres node has message_id as a unique key (requires: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_messages_message_id ON messages(message_id))
ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING ensures idempotency: if same messageId comes twice, only first insert succeeds
FlowLint detects the 'messageId' upstream of the mutation node (Postgres)
This is the most robust approach for databases
